task.title: Authentication Steps
task.shortdesc: The steps to authenticate with a 3CLogic server may vary based on specific configurations.

taskbody.context:
These are some general steps which can be followed to connect OBS Studio to the 3CLogic server.
For detailed and tailored assistance, it is recommended to consult 3CLogic official IT support resources.

ul.li: For OBS Studio versions 28 and above, the WebSocket functionality is built-in.
For versions below 28, download and install the obs-websocket plugin.

ol.li:
Configure OBS WebSocket Setting:
Navigate to the Tools menu and select WebSocket Server Settings.
Ensure the WebSocket server is enabled.
Set a secure password for authentication.

Obtain 3CLogic Integration Details:
Contact 3CLogic administrator or consult the 3CLogic integration documentation to acquire necessary integration credentials and server details.

Configure 3CLogic to Connect with OBS Studio:
Access the 3CLogic administration portal.
Navigate to the integration settings section.
Enter the OBS Studio WebSocket server details, including the IP address, port (default is 4444), and the password set earlier.

Test the Integration:
Restart both OBS Studio and the 3CLogic application.
Perform a test to ensure that 3CLogic can control and interact with OBS Studio as intended.
